meanings.definition: Capable of being used or operated
meanings.sent1: The toy car was operable, so the child happily played with it.
meanings.sent2: The computer was operable after the technician fixed it.
meanings.sent3: The operable flashlight helped the hiker find his way in the dark forest.
meanings.sent4: Her operable phone was like a lifeline in times of need.
meanings.sent5: The operable key unlocked the mysterious door to a hidden room.

meanings.definition: In working condition or able to function
meanings.sent1: The operable machine hummed softly as it completed its task.
meanings.sent2: The operable elevator took the guests to the top floor of the hotel.
meanings.sent3: The operable clock ticked cheerfully on the wall, never missing a beat.
meanings.sent4: His operable car was a reliable companion on long road trips.
meanings.sent5: The operable fan provided much-needed relief on hot summer days.
